pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreTitle: [Blessings at Siem Reap pagoda, August 8, 2010, shot on Panasonic camera]
pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreDescription:
[PRELIMINARY DESCRIPTION]
Footage of 60-70 residents from Chi Kreng district who gathered at a pagoda on August 8, 2010 in Siem Reap province. The Chi Kreng residents were there to receive blessings from a monk and to pray for the release of twelve fellow villagers who have been detained as a result on an ongoing land grabbing dispute and a shooting incident in March 2009.
Includes b-roll from ceremonies, villagers sitting in pagoda, villagers praying and lighting incense, monk reading blessing. Exterior shots of pagoda, and LICADHO staffers Chin Sokly and Srey Vutha interviewing villagers with Kodak camera. Short interview with Vutha, in which he explains why they are there. Shots of Srey Vann using the Kodak camera.
Background information: On March 22, 2009, four villagers were wounded by members of a joint force - including police, military police, border police and soldiers - when they opened fire on a crowd in Anlong Samnor commune in Chi Kreng district during a confrontation over disputed land. Charges including robbery and physical assault were then laid against several villagers to threaten and intimidate them into forfeiting their land. The villagers were among a total of 175 families who have been using the farmland since 1986, and whose efforts to obtain legal ownership documents for the land in 2004 were twice rebuffed by local authorities. These local authorities later allegedly supported several businessmen to lay claim to the land. Summary
